title: Calories in an Old Fashioned Cocktail
meta_description: Discover calories in old fashioned cocktails, including carbs, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown for one serving, plus recipe tweaks.
h1: Calories in an Old Fashioned Cocktail
assumptions: Standard recipe: 2 oz bourbon whiskey (80 proof), 1 sugar cube (or 1 tsp simple syrup), 2 dashes Angostura bitters, no garnish calories included.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, whiskey proof, sugar amount, and bitters brand. Alcoholic beverages' values are approximate; consult labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard Old Fashioned cocktail contains about 155 kcal, primarily from the whiskey and sugar.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison, though alcohol content is not listed on standard labels.

tweaks.label: Use diet sweetener (e.g., stevia) instead of sugar
Omit sugar for a drier version

faqs.q: How many calories in one old fashioned?
faqs.a: Approximately 155 kcal for a standard recipe.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in old fashioned?
faqs.a: The whiskey (about 128 kcal) and sugar (16 kcal); bitters add negligible amounts.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in an old fashioned cocktail?
faqs.a: Yes, about 4.2 g from the sugar, with no fiber.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in old fashioned?
faqs.a: Higher proof whiskey increases calories; 100 proof adds ~20-30 kcal per drink versus 80 proof.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-calorie old fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, skip the sugar or use a zero-calorie sweetener to reduce to ~139 kcal.
